Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants can stay their removal based on alleged irreparable harm and new risk allegations
Outcome: Motion for stay dismissed; removal order remains in effect
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refusal to defer removal
Credibility_Assessment: Claims of harm based on sexual orientation and psychological impact deemed insufficient and untimely
Evidence_Type: Alleged harm due to sexual orientation, psychological harm from deportation
Basis_of_Claim: Potential harm due to sexual orientation, psychological harm from removal
Evaluation_Standard: Tri-partite test: likelihood of success, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Untimeliness of claims, lack of evidence of negligence by prior counsel, no proof of irreparable harm
Application_Error: Failure to raise sexual orientation as a basis for claim earlier
Assessment_Standard: Tri-partite test for judicial review in immigration cases
Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test for stay in immigration matters
Application_Factor: New risk allegations not raised in time
Decision_Outcome: Applicants must leave Canada as scheduled
Decision_Review_Issue: Refusal of deferral request for removal to Colombia
Cause_of_Refusal: Multiple unsuccessful immigration applications; untimely and unsubstantiated new claims
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of clear evidence of irreparable harm or counsel negligence
Credibility_Issues: Late disclosure of sexual orientation as protection ground
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of irreparable harm and new risks upon return to Colombia
Procedural_Issue: Timing and admissibility of new allegations in judicial review
Omission_Type: Failure to previously raise sexual orientation in immigration claims
